roles.name: Investment Banker
roles.description: Advises corporations on mergers, acquisitions, and capital raising. Structures complex financial deals to meet strategic objectives.

meta.typicalBackground: Finance or business degree, strong analytical and negotiation skills, high-pressure client interactions
challenges: Market volatility, aligning interests of multiple stakeholders, intense competition from rival banks

sampleUseCase.scenario: An investment banker structures a cross-border M&A deal, ensuring regulatory compliance and synergy valuations that attract a foreign investor group.

roles.name: Financial Analyst
roles.description: Evaluates companies, markets, or projects for potential investments, uses financial data to forecast performance and inform decisions.

meta.typicalBackground: Finance or accounting background, strong Excel or modeling proficiency, can interpret macro/micro trends
challenges: Ensuring data accuracy, dealing with incomplete disclosures, fast-moving market changes

sampleUseCase.scenario: A financial analyst recommends buying undervalued tech stocks after analyzing Q2 earnings and growth potential, leading to above-average portfolio returns.

roles.name: Portfolio Manager
roles.description: Manages investment portfolios (mutual funds, pensions, endowments) balancing risk and return objectives.

meta.typicalBackground: CFA or similar qualifications, deep understanding of asset allocation, performance metrics
challenges: Client risk tolerance vs. market realities, global economic uncertainties, competition from passive ETFs

sampleUseCase.scenario: A portfolio manager shifts allocations from cyclical equities to defensive stocks and treasury bonds, anticipating an economic downturn and preserving capital for clients.

roles.name: Compliance Officer
roles.description: Ensures financial institutions follow regulations (AML, KYC, securities law), preventing illicit activities and safeguarding consumer rights.

meta.typicalBackground: Legal or compliance background, thorough knowledge of finance regulations, audit/investigative mindset
challenges: Constant regulatory evolution, cross-border differences, sophisticated financial crimes (fraud, laundering)

sampleUseCase.scenario: A compliance officer uncovers suspicious money flows from shell accounts, flags them for internal investigation, and files a SAR to authorities, preventing large-scale illicit transfers.

roles.name: Credit Risk Manager
roles.description: Analyzes borrowersâ€™ creditworthiness, sets lending terms, and mitigates default risks via policies or hedging instruments.

meta.typicalBackground: Accounting or finance background, strong quantitative analysis, knowledge of credit modeling
keyTools: Credit scoring models (FICO, custom PD/LGD), portfolio stress testing, collateral management systems
challenges: Economic downturns raising default rates, limited borrower data in emerging markets, balancing growth vs. risk appetite

sampleUseCase.scenario: A risk manager tightens credit criteria for subprime consumer loans after detecting an uptick in delinquencies, preventing further losses in the next quarter.
